sect1.title: Output with Remarks, Metadata or Draft Watermark
sect1.para: &dapsacr; offers a number of features to simplify review and translation processes. For example, you can insert remark elements in the source code and generate an output format that either includes or suppresses these remarks. You can also generate preview versions of your documentation with a DRAFT watermark appearing on the HTML or PDF output. If you use &dm; in addition to &dapsacr;, you can flag your XML files with meta-information (like workflow status). &dapsacr; offers an option to also display this meta-information in the generated output.

For publishing a pre-release version of a document that you might want to send to a proofreader for review, &dapsacr; provides several features, like enabling DRAFT watermark, including file metadata in the output (like file maintainer or editing statusa use the --draft command option to mark the document as draft version. When generating PDFs with FOP, the contents of the remark elements is shown in italics within the text. XEP supports conversion of remark elements into PDF annotations. This feature is enabled in &dapsacr; by default, but if you want XEP to treat remark elements like FOP does, you can change the respective &dapsacr; parameter.taroth 2012-10-16: todo - add link as soon as this is covered in &dapsuser; Enabling remarks automatically turns draft mode on.

note.title: Output with Remarks or Draft Watermark
note.para: The command options --draft option and --remarks are supported for HTML and PDF, but not for all &dapsacr; output formats.

sect1.para: By default, &dapsacr; adds a string to the base name of the output file to flag output formats generated with special options. Example file names are daps-example_draft_en.pdf or daps-example_remarks_draft_en.pdf.
